alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Coastal Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 04 at 3:07AM EDT until November 06 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH AT LEAST LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement today, choppy surf with breaking waves up to 5 feet and a Moderate risk of rip currents. For the High Rip Current Risk tomorrow, numerous, strong and dangerous rip currents expected with breaking waves building to around 6 feet. * WHERE...Coastal Volusia, Coastal Indian River, Coastal Saint Lucie, Coastal Martin, Mainland Northern Brevard, Northern Brevard Barrier Islands, Mainland Southern Brevard and Southern Brevard Barrier Islands Counties. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through late tonight. For the High Rip Current Risk, from late tonight through at least late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Large breaking waves can knock you off your feet and make you even more susceptible to becoming caught in the seaward pull of a rip current. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a multi-day event with life- threatening surf and rip current conditions, which will last through at least the middle of next week!
info.instruction: Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. Entering the surf over the next several days is very strongly discouraged!!
